alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 4:05PM MST until August 18 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 402 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along the base of the Vermilion Cliffs, west of Marble Canyon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Portions of SR 89A along the Vermilion Cliffs. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 540 and 560. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... South Fork Soap Creek, Soap Creek, Badger Canyon, Emmett Wash and House Rock Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
